action.action-desc: Mr. Michaud (for himself, Mr. Miller of Florida, and Ms. Herseth) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to expand the scope of programs of education for which accelerated payments of educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill may be used, and for other purposes.

section.header: Expansion of programs of education eligible for accelerated payments of educational assistance under the Montgomery GI Bill

subsection.text: Subsection (b)(1) of section 3014A of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting (A) after that leads to; and
by inserting before the semicolon at the end the following: or (B) employment as an operator of a commercial motor vehicle (as defined in section 31301(4) of title 49).
The heading of section 3014A of such title is amended by adding at the end the following:

text.header-in-text: and employment in certain other occupations

paragraph.text: The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 30 of such title is amended in the item relating to section 3014A by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: and employment in certain other occupations

section.header: Exclusion of benefit payments under the Montgomery GI Bill from income for eligibility determinations for Federal education loans
section.text: Section 3015 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (h) as subsection (i); and
by inserting after subsection (g) the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, amounts payable by the Secretary under this subchapter with respect to an eligible individual shall not be considered as income for purposes of determining eligibility of such individual for education grants or loans under any other provision of Federal law.
